quote: Mind precedes all mental states. Mind is their chief; they are all mind-wrought.
author: The Dhammapada

quote: Mind precedes all mental states. Mind is their chief; they are all mind-wrought. If with an impure mind one speaks or acts, suffering follows him like the wheel that follows the ox that draws the cart.
author: The Dhammapada

quote: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
author: The Dhammapada

quote: Better than a thousand hollow words is one word that brings peace.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: If you light a lamp for someone else it will also brighten your path.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
author: Gautama Buddha

author: Gautama Buddha

quote: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Purity or impurity depends on oneself. No one can purify another.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: True love is born from understanding.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Whatever precious jewel there is in the heavenly worlds, there is nothing comparable to one who is Awakened.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Should a person do good, let him do it again and again. Let him find pleasure therein, for blissful is the accumulation of good.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Avoid evil deeds as a man who loves life avoids poison.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: If you are quiet enough, you will hear the flow of the universe. You will feel its rhythm. Go with this flow. Happiness lies ahead. Meditation is key.
author: Uncertain attribution (modern Buddhist teaching)

quote: Whatever is not yours: let go of it. Your letting go of it will be for your long-term happiness and benefit.
author: Gautama Buddha
